member.summary: Gets the value of the user's claim of given claimType. Gets empty string also if the user does not have a claim of given claimType.

member.name: T:Frontend.Vanilla.DomainSpecificLanguage.Providers.Contracts.ICookiesDslProvider
member.summary: Provides generic access to cookies.

member.name: P:Frontend.Vanilla.DomainSpecificLanguage.Providers.Contracts.ICookiesDslProvider.LabelDomain
member.summary: Label-specific cookie domain which makes the cookie accessible on all products of current label.

member.name: P:Frontend.Vanilla.DomainSpecificLanguage.Providers.Contracts.ICookiesDslProvider.FullDomain
member.summary: Full cookie domain which makes the cookie accessible only on this app (product).

member.name: M:Frontend.Vanilla.DomainSpecificLanguage.Providers.Contracts.ICookiesDslProvider.Get(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the value of the cookie with given name e.g. 'TrackerId'. Name is case-insensitive. Gets empty string if there is no cookie with given name.

member.name: M:Frontend.Vanilla.DomainSpecificLanguage.Providers.Contracts.ICookiesDslProvider.SetSession(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sets session cookie with given name to given value. It expires when browser is closed and it's accessible by all product of current label.

member.name: M:Frontend.Vanilla.DomainSpecificLanguage.Providers.Contracts.ICookiesDslProvider.SetPersistent(System.String,System.String,System.Decimal)
member.summary: Sets persistent cookie with given name to given value. Its expiration can be relative seconds e.g. from 'Time' DSL provider or absolute unix time e.g. from 'DateTime' DSL provider. The cookie will be accessible by all product of current label.

member.name: M:Frontend.Vanilla.DomainSpecificLanguage.Providers.Contracts.ICookiesDslProvider.Delete(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes cookie with given name.

member.name: M:Frontend.Vanilla.DomainSpecificLanguage.Providers.Contracts.ICookiesDslProvider.Set(System.String,System.String,System.Decimal,System.Boolean,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Low-level function to set cookie with all its details. Use with care and prefer other functions. If expiration is below 0 then cookie is deleted. If it's zero then it's session cookie. Otherwise it's permanent one. Domain should be Cookies.LabelDomain or Cookies.FullDomain.

member.name: P:Frontend.Vanilla.DomainSpecificLanguage.Providers.Contracts.ICultureDslProvider.Default
member.summary: Gets configured default .NET culture for current label e.g. en-US.

member.name: M:Frontend.Vanilla.DomainSpecificLanguage.Providers.Contracts.ICultureDslProvider.GetAllowed
member.summary: Gets allowed .NET cultures configured for current label and user (hidden cultures) joined with comma e.g. en-US, de-AT.

member.name: P:Frontend.Vanilla.DomainSpecificLanguage.Providers.Contracts.ICultureDslProvider.Current
member.summary: Gets currently set (resolved) .NET culture corresponding to one selected in the language switcher e.g. de-AT. The resolution details: .

member.name: M:Frontend.Vanilla.DomainSpecificLanguage.Providers.Contracts.ICultureDslProvider.GetFromClaims
member.summary: Gets .NET culture from allowed configured ones corresponding to http://api.bwin.com/v3/user/culture claim. Claims are issued by PosAPI. For logged-in user usually it's the one from settings/registration. Returns empty string if the claim is missing or invalid.

member.name: M:Frontend.Vanilla.DomainSpecificLanguage.Providers.Contracts.ICultureDslProvider.GetFromBrowser
member.summary: Gets .NET culture from allowed configured ones corresponding to 'Accept-Language' HTTP request header sent by user's browser according to his language preferences. Returns empty string if there is no corresponding culture.

member.name: M:Frontend.Vanilla.DomainSpecificLanguage.Providers.Contracts.ICultureDslProvider.GetFromPreviousVisit
member.summary: Gets .NET culture from allowed configured ones corresponding to 'UserSettings' cookie which is the culture used last time when the user visited this website using particular browser. Returns empty string if it's first user's visit or culture in the cookie isn't allowed on the label anymore.

member.name: M:Frontend.Vanilla.DomainSpecificLanguage.Providers.Contracts.ICultureDslProvider.GetUrlToken(System.String)
member.summary: Gets configured URL token (usually first path segment) for given .NET culture name. Examples: en-US -> en, es-419 -> ex-xl.

member.name: T:Frontend.Vanilla.DomainSpecificLanguage.Providers.Contracts.IDateTimeDslProvider
member.summary: Provides properties and functions for retrieving current date and time in UNIX time format which allows comparisons using regular number operators =, <>, >, >=, <=, < . Also it can be combined with 'Time' DSL provider. Example: DateTime.Today >= DateTime.Date(2018, 11, 5).

member.name: M:Frontend.Vanilla.DomainSpecificLanguage.Providers.Contracts.IDateTimeDslProvider.GetNow
member.summary: Gets current date and time in user's time zone as a UNIX time. Precision is in minutes (seconds are always 0) for easier comparison with other members.

member.name: M:Frontend.Vanilla.DomainSpecificLanguage.Providers.Contracts.IDateTimeDslProvider.GetUtcNow
member.summary: Gets current UTC date and time as a UNIX time. Precision is in minutes (seconds are always 0) for easier comparison with other members.

member.name: M:Frontend.Vanilla.DomainSpecificLanguage.Providers.Contracts.IDateTimeDslProvider.GetToday
member.summary: Gets current date in user's time zone as a UNIX time. Time of the day is 00:00:00.

member.name: M:Frontend.Vanilla.DomainSpecificLanguage.Providers.Contracts.IDateTimeDslProvider.GetUtcToday
member.summary: Gets current UTC date as a UNIX time. Time of the day is 00:00:00.

member.name: M:Frontend.Vanilla.DomainSpecificLanguage.Providers.Contracts.IDateTimeDslProvider.GetTimeOfDay
member.summary: Gets current time of day in user's time zone in a format compatible with UNIX time. Precision is in minutes (seconds are always 0) for easier comparison with other members.

member.name: M:Frontend.Vanilla.DomainSpecificLanguage.Providers.Contracts.IDateTimeDslProvider.GetUtcTimeOfDay
member.summary: Gets current time of day in UTC in a format compatible with UNIX time. Precision is in minutes (seconds are always 0) for easier comparison with other members.

member.name: M:Frontend.Vanilla.DomainSpecificLanguage.Providers.Contracts.IDateTimeDslProvider.GetDayOfWeek
member.summary: Gets the name of the current day in user's time zone in English e.g Sunday, Monday.

member.name: M:Frontend.Vanilla.DomainSpecificLanguage.Providers.Contracts.IDateTimeDslProvider.GetUtcDayOfWeek
member.summary: Gets the name of the current day in UTC in English e.g Sunday, Monday.

member.name: M:Frontend.Vanilla.DomainSpecificLanguage.Providers.Contracts.IDateTimeDslProvider.Date(System.Decimal,System.Decimal,System.Decimal)
member.summary: Creates date from passed parameters. Parameters together must represent valid date. Year represents year as integer number. Month represents month as integer number (January = 1, February = 2 ...). Minimum value is 1, and maximum is 12. Day represents day in month as integer number. Minimum value is 1, and maximum depends on month and year.

member.name: M:Frontend.Vanilla.DomainSpecificLanguage.Providers.Contracts.IDateTimeDslProvider.UtcDate(System.Decimal,System.Decimal,System.Decimal)
member.summary: Creates date from passed parameters. Parameters together must represent valid date. Year represents year as integer number. Month represents month as integer number (January = 1, February = 2 ...). Minimum value is 1, and maximum is 12. Day represents day in month as integer number. Minimum value is 1, and maximum depends on month and year.

member.name: M:Frontend.Vanilla.DomainSpecificLanguage.Providers.Contracts.IDateTimeDslProvider.DateTime(System.Decimal,System.Decimal,System.Decimal,System.Decimal,System.Decimal)
member.summary: Creates date and time from passed parameters. Parameters together must represent valid date and time. Year represents year as integer number. Month represents month as integer number (January = 1, February = 2 ...). Minimum value is 1, and maximum 12. Day represents day in month as integer number. Minimum value is 1, and maximum depends on month and year. Hours represent hours as integer number. Minimum value is 0, and maximum is 23. Minutes represent minutes as integer number. Minimum value is 0, and maximum is 60.

member.name: M:Frontend.Vanilla.DomainSpecificLanguage.Providers.Contracts.IDateTimeDslProvider.UtcDateTime(System.Decimal,System.Decimal,System.Decimal,System.Decimal,System.Decimal)
member.summary: Creates date and time from passed parameters. Parameters together must represent valid date and time. Year represents year as integer number. Month represents month as integer number (January = 1, February = 2 ...). Minimum value is 1, and maximum 12. Day represents day in month as integer number. Minimum value is 1, and maximum depends on month and year. Hours represent hours as integer number. Minimum value is 0, and maximum is 23. Minutes represent minutes as integer number. Minimum value is 0, and maximum is 60.

member.name: M:Frontend.Vanilla.DomainSpecificLanguage.Providers.Contracts.IDateTimeDslProvider.UtcDateTime(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates date and time from passed parameters. Parameters together must represent valid date and time.
member.param: Represents the whole date as string.
Represents the exact format of the DateString. When empty string, a fallback will be used: yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss.

member.name: M:Frontend.Vanilla.DomainSpecificLanguage.Providers.Contracts.IDateTimeDslProvider.Time(System.Decimal,System.Decimal)
member.summary: Creates time from passed parameters. Parameters together must represent valid time. Hours represent hours as integer number. Minimum value is 0, and maximum is 23. Minutes represent minutes as integer number. Minimum value is 0, and maximum is 60.

member.name: M:Frontend.Vanilla.DomainSpecificLanguage.Providers.Contracts.IDateTimeDslProvider.Format(System.Decimal,System.Decimal,System.Decimal)
member.summary: Creates time from passed parameters. Parameters together must represent valid time. Hours represent hours as integer number. Minimum value is 0, and maximum is 23. Minutes represent minutes as integer number. Minimum value is 0, and maximum is 60.

member.name: F:Frontend.Vanilla.DomainSpecificLanguage.Providers.ValueVolatility.Server
member.summary: Value can change between full page requests but doesn't change during lifetime of the single page application. This guarantees good performance e.g. content is already filtered on server and doesn't even get transferred to client browser.

member.name: F:Frontend.Vanilla.DomainSpecificLanguage.Providers.ValueVolatility.Client
member.summary: Value can change anytime thus should be evaluated on client browser in the single page application. This introduced additional overhead but gives the best user experience.

member.name: F:Frontend.Vanilla.DomainSpecificLanguage.Providers.ValueVolatility.Static
member.summary: Value doesn't ever change. It's evaluated already during compilation. Usually it's static configuration value of the app. This has totally the best performance.
